sentence.idiomatic: Right now it's 5 to 3.
The red team beat the green team 6 to 2.
The score at half time is 45 to 47. The Rockets are in the lead.
I threw two balls; one went in.
Did Yao Ming make the shot?
I voted for candidate number two.
You kicked someone. That's a foul.
If the red team fouls again, they will be docked points.
You have already fouled more than ten times.
Hurry, pass the ball to me.
Please pass the ticket to that gentleman.
When will the Olympic torch pass through Shanghai?
Yeah! We won!
I beat him again this time.
Who won in yesterday's match?
You are two against one, it's not fair.
Tonight's match is Team China versus Team USA.
If you play one on one, he will definitely beat you.
You dare to hit his son? You've got guts.
Who has guts? Who is a wimp? Give it a try and see.
Whoever has got the guts, come out and face me himself.
What's the score?

word.literal: to be at the same level

sentence.idiomatic: It's a 3 to 3 tie. Your ball.
Oooh!
Beautiful shot.
Yeah, tell me something I don't know... 4 to 3... Foul!
Whatever!
You totally fouled me!

Fine... 5 to 3... Daddy wins!
